Detailed Description

Central instance managing all currently opened windows. For traversing opened windows it is recommended to use the WindowHierarchyIterator instead of accessing the WindowManager directly.

Member Function Documentation

Window * WindowManager::GetDisplayForegrWin (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns a pointer to the foreground window of the display with index display_idx.

static Window* WindowManager::GetForegroundWindow (   )  [inline, static]
 

Returns a pointer to the window staying in foreground. Note that on the returned window operations may only be invoked if they are executed in the context of its application.

void WindowManager::Insert (  Window *  win,
Window *  foregr_win = 0
)  [static]
 

Inserts the window win on top of the window-stack, if foregr_win is 0. Otherwise the window is inserted below foregr_win. Invoking this method should not be necessary by the MMI, as it is used internally when opening a window.

BOOLEAN WindowManager::IsAlphaMaskEnabled (   )  [static]
 

Returns TRUE, if the alpha mask is enabled. See WindowManager::SetAlphaMaskEnabled for details.

void WindowManager::Remove (  Window *  win  )  [static]
 

Removes the window win from the window-stack. Invoking this method should not be necessary by the MMI, as it is used internally when closing a window.

void WindowManager::SetAlphaMaskEnabled (  BOOLEAN  flag  )  [static]
 

The APOXI display device allows to have an alpha mask, which might get blended with a viewfinder or a video. As updating the alpha mask can get very time consuming, each application has to turn on the alpha mask explicitely by this method, if it shows a viewfinder or a video. It is recommended that the application turns on the alpha channel inside Window::OnOpen and turning off inside Window::OnClose. APOXI does a reference counting internally, so that a nested invoking of different applications does not have any side effects.
